etymology.description: Ideogram: a line above another—‘up’; originally 𠄞, later changed to avoid confusion with 二.
etymology.interpretation: A short stroke sits above a longer baseline, picturing something positioned over another. In contrast with 下, it indicates upward or superior position. The form was standardized to distinguish it clearly from 二.

examples.chinese: 书在桌子上(書在桌子上)。
examples.english: The book is on the table.

examples.chinese: 我们上楼去(我們上樓去)。
上课时(上課時)，请把手机放在桌上(請把手機放在桌上)。
examples.pinyin: Shàng kè shí, qǐng bǎ shǒujī fàng zài zhuō shàng.
examples.english: During class, please put your phone on the desk.
